channel.title: R on Paul Hook
channel.description: Recent content in R on Paul Hook

item.title: Scraping bioRxiv Part 1
item.description: Premise For my first actual blog post, I have decided to start a series about preprints. Awhile ago, an interesting question was brought up by Shannon Ellis in her wonderful blog post “Let there be preprint citations!” (emphasis is mine): Problem #2: Preprints often become peer-reviewed research. How will we keep track? Solution #2a (if this occurs during while the manuscript is being drafted): It is up to the author(s) to ensure that their manuscript is as up to date as possible upon submission for publication.

item.title: My first blog post!
item.description: Hello! If you haven’t been able to tell by the website already, my name is Paul Hook. I am a fourth year Ph.D. student in the Human Genetics program in the McKusick-Nathans Institute of Genetic Medicine at the Johns Hopkins University School of Medicine. You can learn alittle bit more about me here, so I won’t go on and on in the inaugural blog post. One of the reasons I was driven to create a website/blog was the blog of one of my former Human Genetics program-mates, Shannon Ellis.
